trans-unit.source: Specifies the Client Secret value from the App Registration in Microsoft Entra ID. This value is used to authenticate the connection to SharePoint.

Page Ext. SharePoint Account - Control SecretField - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies the password used to protect the private key in the certificate. Leave empty if the certificate is not password-protected.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the password used to protect the private key in the certificate. Leave empty if the certificate is not password-protected.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the Client Secret value from the App Registration in Microsoft Entra ID. This value is used to authenticate the connection to SharePoint.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the password used to protect the private key in the certificate. Leave empty if the certificate is not password-protected.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the password used to protect the private key in the certificate. Leave empty if the certificate is not password-protected.
trans-unit.note: Page Ext. SharePoint Account Wizard - Control CertificatePasswordField - Property ToolTip
Page Ext. SharePoint Account Wizard - Control CertificatePasswordField - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies the authentication flow used for this SharePoint account. Client Secret uses User grant flow, which means that the user must sign in when using this account. Certificate uses Client credentials flow, which means that the user does not need to sign in when using this account.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the authentication flow used for this SharePoint account. Client Secret uses User grant flow, which means that the user must sign in when using this account. Certificate uses Client credentials flow, which means that the user does not need to sign in when using this account.
trans-unit.note: Page Ext. SharePoint Account Wizard - Control Authentication Type - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the certificate file used for authentication. Click here to upload a certificate file (.pfx, .cer, or .crt).
trans-unit.target: Specifies the certificate file used for authentication. Click here to upload a certificate file (.pfx, .cer, or .crt).
trans-unit.note: Page Ext. SharePoint Account Wizard - Control CertificateUploadStatus - Property ToolTip
Page Ext. SharePoint Account Wizard - Control CertificateUploadStatus - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies the Client ID (Application ID) of the App Registration in Microsoft Entra ID.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the Microsoft Entra ID Tenant ID (Directory ID) where your SharePoint site and app registration are located.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the Microsoft Entra ID Tenant ID (Directory ID) where your SharePoint site and app registration are located.
trans-unit.note: Page Ext. SharePoint Account Wizard - Control Tenant Id - Property ToolTip
Page Ext. SharePoint Account Wizard - Control SharePoint Url - Property Caption
Page Ext. SharePoint Account Wizard - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies the folder path relative to the site collection. Start with the document library or folder name (e.g., Shared Documents/Reports). This path can be copied from the URL of the folder in SharePoint after the site collection (e.g., /Shared Documents/Reports from https://mysharepoint.sharepoint.com/sites/ProjectX/Shared%20Documents/Reports).
trans-unit.target: Specifies the folder path relative to the site collection. Start with the document library or folder name (e.g., Shared Documents/Reports). This path can be copied from the URL of the folder in SharePoint after the site collection (e.g., /Shared Documents/Reports from https://mysharepoint.sharepoint.com/sites/ProjectX/Shared%20Documents/Reports).
trans-unit.note: Table Ext. SharePoint Account - Field Base Relative Folder Path - Property ToolTip
Table Ext. SharePoint Account - Field Base Relative Folder Path - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies if the account is disabled. Accounts are automatically disabled when a sandbox environment is created from production.
trans-unit.target: Specifies if the account is disabled. Accounts are automatically disabled when a sandbox environment is created from production.

Table Ext. SharePoint Account - Field Disabled - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies the authentication flow used for this SharePoint account. Client Secret uses User grant flow, which means that the user must sign in when using this account.
